qas.question: In which year was Campus Martius open?
What area has Detroit been trying to redevelop?
In which year did Detroit celebrate it's 300th anniversary?
Which two areas were connected by the Port Authority Passenger Terminal?

answers.text: Hart Plaza to the Renaissance Center

context: Campus Martius, a reconfiguration of downtown's main intersection as a new park was opened in <a0_0>2004<a0_0/>. The park has been cited as one of the best public spaces in the United States. The city's <a1_0>riverfront<a1_0/> has been the focus of redevelopment, following successful examples of other older industrial cities. In <a2_0>2001<a2_0/>, the first portion of the International Riverfront was completed as a part of the city's 300th anniversary celebration, with miles of parks and associated landscaping completed in succeeding years. In 2011, the <a3_0>Port Authority Passenger Terminal<a3_0/> opened with the river walk connecting <a4_0>Hart Plaza to the Renaissance Center<a4_0/>.
